thread_name: What is the evaluation time of next level prmotion
frequent_posters: professional421, me_bharat, mariashtelle1, uk1000, jake_hopkins, imagination7413
thread_text:
My criteria for level one is completed so i want to know that on what time the next level badge will be given to me.(i know it,s tomorrow 15th august but i want to know exact time.)
On which country time the evaluation will be announced and also what will be the exact time.
Thanks in advance!
reply_text:
I don’t think there is an specific time that they will give the badge to you (if your stats are okay), even though it says “Evaluation period ends on Aug 15, 2020, 00:00 GMT”. That might be the date/time it looks at the figures to. And/or when the process to check stats starts.
Basically I think the process that Fiverr runs starts at a particular time and it probably takes hours to run, so different people will get their badges (or lose them) at different times.
edit: eg. I’ve received emails about my level stats (saying gone up a level or down one) from Fiverr on the 15th and the times are anywhere between 09:18 to 11:43 UK time.

thread_name: Will I be promoted to Level 2?
frequent_posters: graphiquedees, english_voice, blavaro, mariashtelle1, imagination7413
thread_text:
I recently got an order without inbox discussion, although my gig clearly states to contact me before order placement. So out of fear of getting an order cancelled I made the design for the cheap price the buyer wanted. But the buyer never replied to my questions for his design and I made one according to myself, and he didn’t like it and wanted to cancel order. I didn’t have time due to lined up orders, so I accepted it. My order completion fell to 98%. I have all requirements complete for level 2. I just want to make sure this fall in order completion won’t keep me from getting my level 2 badge.
Just so everybody knows, I’m still quite new. Its been just a little over 3 months I joined fiverr. So I’m not ver experienced. Looking for opinions from experienced sellers. Thanks!
reply_text:
graphiquedees:
Looking for opinions from experienced sellers.
You don’t need opinions from experienced sellers, all you need to do is to read what’s written in your account.
But I’ll help you, it need to be over 90%.

thread_name: Will I be promoted to Level 2?
frequent_posters: graphiquedees, english_voice, blavaro, mariashtelle1, imagination7413
thread_text:
I recently got an order without inbox discussion, although my gig clearly states to contact me before order placement. So out of fear of getting an order cancelled I made the design for the cheap price the buyer wanted. But the buyer never replied to my questions for his design and I made one according to myself, and he didn’t like it and wanted to cancel order. I didn’t have time due to lined up orders, so I accepted it. My order completion fell to 98%. I have all requirements complete for level 2. I just want to make sure this fall in order completion won’t keep me from getting my level 2 badge.
Just so everybody knows, I’m still quite new. Its been just a little over 3 months I joined fiverr. So I’m not ver experienced. Looking for opinions from experienced sellers. Thanks!
reply_text:
This isn’t a criticism - but your story is a reminder to all sellers about the importance of ensuring a clear client brief is in place before starting work.
Without a clear brief, how can any seller know what their buyer wants? You just took a guess, and the client didn’t like the result.
If a buyer doesn’t communicate - even after asking them for a brief, the best thing to do is to ask customer support to cancel the order. If you can clearly show that the client has not sent instructions, then CS can cancel an order without it affecting your stats. This is discretionary on their part though.
However, by blindly carrying on and guessing what the client wants you are simply wasting your time. In your case, the buyer eventually took control by requesting a cancellation. Had you instead taken control, you might have saved your stats.

reply_text:
Read https://www.fiverr.com/levels please.
Requirements L2
Complete at least 120 days as an active Seller on Fiverr
Complete at least 50 individual orders (all time)
Earn at least $2,000
Maintain a 4.7 star rating over the course of 60 days
90% Response rate over the course of 60 days
90% Order completion over the course of 60 days
90% On-time Delivery over the course of 60 days
Avoiding receiving warnings over the course of 30 days

reply_text: I think you are right that I shouldn’t have wasted my time on a client who didn’t explain what he want. But I quickly searched on fiverr forum itself if there is any way I could save my order completion. Every thread said there is no way to do that, even customer support. So I agreed to cancel the order and added on the very top of my gig to communicate with me before placing an order in Bold capital letters. But if it is true that you can save your completion rate, I will definitely look more into it the next time. Thankyou for your constructive criticism
